name: 1701 E St NE
notes: "Genesis Capital sold the six unit multi-family building to Shrihari Middleburg LLC for $1,850,000 or $308,330 per unit. The deed shows the transaction closed on October 22nd but the buyer did not sign until October 31st. The building was 100% leased at the time of sale. This transaction was an REO sale. The buyer reported the property sold with deferred maintenance which included roof repairs, plumbing issues and cosmetic upgrades which resulted in a $625,000 credit to cover the cost to cure. The cap rate was reported to 11.35% at the time of sale from a net operating income of $210,000.

name: 4020-4040 Livingston Rd SE
notes: Tsintolas Realty Co sold the 31 unit multi-family building to TriStar for $2,050,000 or $66,130 per unit. The property was between 77%-80% at the time of sale. The buyer indicated that the acquisition was made with the intent to generate profit. The cap rate generated for this transaction was 8% yielding an estimated net operating income of $164,000. The pro-forma, based on projected stabilized income, was estimated to be around 11.6%.The information in this sale comparable report was confirmed with the listing agency and verified with a representative of the buyer.

The seller, a local business and commercial real estate owner had owned and managed the property for over 35 years.The property was vacant at the time of sale and is currently undergoing a complete renovation including adding an additional unit.The buyer anticiaptes the rehab will be finsihed by May 2025 and once complete, the property will be rented out as affordable housing.

The properties occupancy couldn't’t be confirmed at the time of the closing.  The property was on the market for 23-months, with an initial asking price of $1,395,000. The seller was motivated to divest the property because they were retiring. The buyer was drawn to the property as they were looking for a new investment. The buyers are looking to complete renovations within the next 6 months before they begin to lease out the units.  Financing was a part of this transaction with a down payment of $782,500.
